alert.note: Alert for Owyhee Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:27PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Owyhee and east central Malheur Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 327 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Little Grassy Reservoir, or 18 miles east of Rome, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Castro Ridge around 330 PM MDT. Antelope Reservoir and Parsnip Peak around 340 PM MDT. Jordan Valley around 400 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
